page.title: 10Hengistbury Head
page.content: Hengistbury Head is a public open space which is very popular with local people and tourists because of its beauty,facilities and views of the sea,coastline and Christchurch Harbour.It has beaches and there are beach huts on the spit at the end of the head which can be reached by foot and'Noddy train'or by ferry from Mudeford.There is an 18 hole golf course and a fitness circuit on the Head. There is also a Marine Training Centre where young people are taught water sports in the safety of the harbour.Environmental studies are also taught at the Centre because Hengistbury Head provides a variety of natural habitats and has a rich history.During 1985 an iron age village is being excavated.
